author: mariusvanderwijden
content:
qq: whats the container size bounded by?
I am trying to get a feel for the edge cases of the container validation. I have some test that takes ~50s to verify but with a container that is 60MB in size. I guess the contracts size limit or initcode size limits still apply?

author: chfast
content: We are bounding it to 48k (previously only bounded by 16-bit sizes): https://github.com/ipsilon/eof/pull/125

author: chfast
content: Does initcode gas cost covers this?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content:
Here's my benchmark for anyone interested.
It takes ~25ms to execute on my implementation. It tries to exploit the logic around which code is still to visit by visiting a bunch of code sections from each other. If we didn't have a limit on container size, this would take ~50 seconds with 1024 sections full of code that calls each other

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: How many deployments/validations of eof containers do you envision as max per block? I get something like 120ms and 67MB ram for 50 validations

author: chfast
content: can these stress test be added to EEST?

author: chfast
content: It looks you can fit 40 tx in a 30M block.

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Sure will try to upstream them

author: _shemnon
content: This looks to be invalid - https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-6206#non-returning-status-validation - All the JUMPFs go to section zero, which is non-returning, and there are no RETFs.  Changing the terminating JUMPF to go to section 1 and changing that to end with NOOP-NOOP-RETF gets it to pass validation.  Here's a fixed version - https://gist.github.com/shemnon/130936090f4a7a11813da3bd36bf43fb.  We should add this to the test set.

author: _shemnon
content: I would also like to see the 1024x64Kib, as a torture test.  Even if it violates current sizing rules.

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Yep, will add it as eels test

author: draganrakita
content: Scratch this, I didn't have Prague activated for statetests, have some failed tests that I am debuging rn. Validation tests are passing.
